definition: axle/(fig.) central element/key element/axis (alliance of nations)
axis/axle/spool (for thread)/roller (for scrolls)/classifier for calligraphy rolls etc
see 壓軸戲|压轴戏[ya1 zhou4 xi4]/Taiwan pr. [zhou2]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]
Axis powers (World War II)
the Axis of Evil

sentences.english: For arteriosus truncus and its branches, ultrasonography detection is not difficult.
sentences.chinese: 主幹帶小分支型皮瓣軸心動脈超聲顯像不難。

sentences.english: Shaft drives are heavy duty to minimize deflection.
sentences.chinese: 紮實的軸心可減少偏斜。

sentences.english: Acting on the vertical axis line direction of load bearing…
sentences.chinese: 作用於垂直軸承軸心線方向的負荷。

sentences.english: The Axis alliance with Japan in the East.
sentences.chinese: 希特勒在東部與日本結成軸心國聯盟。

sentences.english: Capturing the enemy-held towns is the pivot of our plans.
sentences.chinese: 奪取敵人控制的城鎮，是我們計畫的軸心。

sentences.english: Incensed at not being included in the originalAxis of Evil, France refuses to participate.
sentences.chinese: 忿恨於未被美國列爲邪惡軸心之一，法國拒絕參戰。

sentences.english: Japan entered World War I and declared war on the Central Powers.
sentences.chinese: 日本作爲軸心國參加了第一次世界大戰。

sentences.english: Otobong Etuk Why do you think Nigeria would join the axis.
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你認爲尼日利亞會加入軸心國？

sentences.english: The Red Army destroyed 507 Axis divisions.
sentences.chinese: 蘇聯紅軍摧毀了軸心國的507個師。

sentences.english: You never get it on... on this axis.
sentences.chinese: 你無法得到它，在這個軸心上。

sentences.english: To be represented at the founding conference in San Francisco, states had to have declared war on the axis powers beforehand.
sentences.chinese: 出席舊金山成立大會的國家必須曾向軸心國宣戰。

sentences.english: Its kernal principle is the central nature of theoretical knowledge.
sentences.chinese: 後工業社會的軸心原則就是理論知識的中心性。

sentences.english: In the bearing radial plane through the axis line direction.
sentences.chinese: 在軸承徑向平面內通過軸心線的方向。

sentences.english: The nut has been worked on the spindle.
sentences.chinese: 螺帽已經擰在軸心上了。

definition: paradigm
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to try hard to/to strive to
to have a unique style of one's own (idiom)
epoch-marking
to do with the masses/mass (meeting, movement etc)
to judge the hour and size up the situation/to take stock
to break up into components/to disintegrate/to collapse/to crumble
modernity
May Fourth Movement/Chinese national renewal movement that started with 4th May 1919 protest against the Treaty of Versailles
like a hot knife through butter (idiom)/with irresistible force
pincer attack/attack from two or more sides/converging attack/attack on a flank/fork in chess, with one piece making two attacks
form of government
see 承前啟後|承前启后[cheng2 qian2 qi3 hou4]
to reconstruct/reconstruction/(computing) refactoring
to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
